intro: Pleurostachys rabenii, commonly known as the Madagascar grass, is a flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the grass family (Poaceae) and is characterized by its tufted growth habit and narrow, grass-like leaves. The plant produces small, spike-like inflorescences that bear tiny, pale blue to white flowers. It is often found in rocky or disturbed soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments. Due to its unique appearance and limited distribution, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
